member.name: M:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDbContextOptionsExtensions.UseInMemoryDatabase``1(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder{``0},System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.InMemoryDbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures the context to connect to an in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider. To use the same in-memory database across service providers, call
passing a shared on which to root the database.
member.remarks: See Using DbContextOptions, and The EF Core in-memory database provider for more information and examples.
member.typeparam: The type of context being configured.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.name: M:Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.InMemoryDbContextOptionsExtensions.UseInMemoryDatabase(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder,System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.InMemoryDbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures the context to connect to a named in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider. To use the same in-memory database across service providers, call
passing a shared on which to root the database.
member.remarks: See Using DbContextOptions, and The EF Core in-memory database provider for more information and examples.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.

member.summary: Configures the context to connect to an in-memory database. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used, but only for a given service provider.
member.remarks: See Using DbContextOptions, and The EF Core in-memory database provider for more information and examples.
member.typeparam: The type of context being configured.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The name of the in-memory database. This allows the scope of the in-memory database to be controlled independently of the context. The in-memory database is shared anywhere the same name is used.

All in-memory databases will be rooted in this object, allowing the application to control their lifetime. This is useful when sometimes the context instance is created explicitly with while at other times it is resolved using dependency injection.
An optional action to allow additional in-memory specific configuration.
member.returns: The options builder so that further configuration can be chained.
